remarks: The group sum depends only on the base set, additive operation, and topology components.  Note that for entirely unrestricted functions, there can be dependency on out-of-domain values of the operation, so this is somewhat weaker than ~ mndpropd etc.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Sep-2015.)
statement:
tsmspropd.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. V ) $.
tsmspropd.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. W ) $.
tsmspropd.h $e |- ( ph -> H e. X ) $.
tsmspropd.b $e |- ( ph -> ( Base ` G ) = ( Base ` H ) ) $.
tsmspropd.p $e |- ( ph -> ( +g ` G ) = ( +g ` H ) ) $.
tsmspropd.j $e |- ( ph -> ( TopOpen ` G ) = ( TopOpen ` H ) ) $.
tsmspropd $p |- ( ph -> ( G tsums F ) = ( H tsums F ) ) $.
